poem:
The Assurances  

East city whispers,   
between walls of red tapes  
and the Thames' silent wave,  
a promise floats—  
ministers' murmurs,  
predetermined paths  
in the waiting air.  
China's shadow falls  
on cobbled streets—  
but who builds dreams  
on assurances  
when shadows hide  
behind closed doors?
